sunlight: Full sun only if soil kept moist
description: Common box (Buxus sempervirens) is an amazing plant species due to its incredible hardiness and versatility. With its leathery, glossy leaves and distinctive, dense evergreen habit, this species requires very little maintenance and is highly tolerant to drought, frost, polluted air, and coastal locations. It grows well in both sun and shade, making it an ideal choice for hedging, topiary, and border edging. It is also a deer and rabbit resistant species! Ultimately, this easy-care species provides exceptional winter colour and year-round structure to any garden, making it a perfect choice for busy gardens.
